20101224193343.000|20101224193345.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101224193345.000|20101224193348.000|TR0|
20101224193348.000|20101224193350.000|TR0|HOLMES:  Now, when children hear about 
20101224193350.000|20101224193353.000|TR0|Santa, they also think about the North 
20101224193353.000|20101224193355.000|TR0|Pole.  But we have to journey all the way 
20101224193355.000|20101224193358.000|TR0|to Turkey and a town called Demre to learn 
20101224193358.000|20101224193400.000|TR0|the real story of old St. Nick.  Our Ivan 
20101224193400.000|20101224193403.000|TR0|Watson has the story.
20101224193403.000|20101224193405.000|TR0|
20101224193405.000|20101224193408.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101224193408.000|20101224193410.000|TR0|
20101224193410.000|20101224193413.000|TR0|IVAN WATSON, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20101224193413.000|20101224193415.000|TR0|(voice-over):  This is the hometown of St. 
20101224193415.000|20101224193418.000|TR0|Nicholas, the man who inspired the legend 
20101224193418.000|20101224193420.000|TR0|of Santa Claus, a Turkish village of 
20101224193420.000|20101224193423.000|TR0|ancient ruins and palm trees perched on 
20101224193423.000|20101224193425.000|TR0|the edge of the Mediterranean Sea.  Turkey 
20101224193425.000|20101224193428.000|TR0|is a long way from the North Pole, but 
20101224193428.000|20101224193430.000|TR0|that has not stopped local leaders from 
20101224193430.000|20101224193433.000|TR0|making Santa Claus the town's official 
20101224193433.000|20101224193435.000|TR0|symbol, where a statue of St. Nicholas

20101224193437.000|20101224193440.000|TR0|

20101224193447.000|20101224193450.000|TR0|

20101224193515.000|20101224193517.000|TR0| It's interesting.     WATSON 
20101224193517.000|20101224193520.000|TR0|(voice-over):  The population of Demre is 
20101224193520.000|20101224193522.000|TR0|overwhelmingly Muslim, but the village's 
20101224193522.000|20101224193525.000|TR0|greatest tourist attraction is this 
20101224193525.000|20101224193527.000|TR0|ancient church built in honor of St. 
20101224193527.000|20101224193530.000|TR0|Nicholas.
20101224193530.000|20101224193532.000|TR0|
20101224193532.000|20101224193535.000|TR0|(on camera):  Nearly 18 centuries after 
20101224193535.000|20101224193537.000|TR0|his death, St. Nicholas is still a very 
20101224193537.000|20101224193540.000|TR0|important figure for many Christians.  
20101224193540.000|20101224193542.000|TR0|More than 600,000 people a year come to 
20101224193542.000|20101224193545.000|TR0|visit this 8th century Byzantine church 
20101224193545.000|20101224193547.000|TR0|built in the town where St. Nicholas once 
20101224193547.000|20101224193550.000|TR0|served as bishop.
20101224193550.000|20101224193552.000|TR0|
20101224193552.000|20101224193555.000|TR0|Well, how did you find this, Professor 
20101224193555.000|20101224193557.000|TR0|Cevik?
20101224193557.000|20101224193600.000|TR0|
20101224193600.000|20101224193602.000|TR0|(voice-over):  Archeologist Nevzat Cevik 
20101224193602.000|20101224193605.000|TR0|has been unearthing ancient Christian 
20101224193605.000|20101224193607.000|TR0|history here.  He says St. Nicholas was a 
20101224193607.000|20101224193610.000|TR0|local Christian priest who destroyed Roman 
20101224193610.000|20101224193612.000|TR0|pagan temples.
20101224193612.000|20101224193615.000|TR0|
20101224193615.000|20101224193617.000|TR0|NEVZAT CEVIK, ARCHEOLOGIST:  St. Nicholas 
20101224193617.000|20101224193620.000|TR0|(INAUDIBLE) his life here and his death 
20101224193620.000|20101224193622.000|TR0|here.  And he talked about Christianity 
20101224193622.000|20101224193625.000|TR0|and (INAUDIBLE) teach the Christianity 
20101224193625.000|20101224193627.000|TR0|(INAUDIBLE) earlier times.
20101224193627.000|20101224193630.000|TR0|
20101224193630.000|20101224193632.000|TR0|WATSON:  Cevik says Nicholas's legend 
20101224193632.000|20101224193634.000|TR0|started to grow after it was first retold 
20101224193634.000|20101224193637.000|TR0|in the 6th century by another local 
20101224193637.000|20101224193639.000|TR0|Christian priest named Nicholas of Scion 
20101224193639.000|20101224193642.000|TR0|(ph).  Soon St. Nicholas's tomb became a 
20101224193642.000|20101224193644.000|TR0|destination for Christian pilgrims from 
20101224193644.000|20101224193647.000|TR0|around the world.
20101224193647.000|20101224193649.000|TR0|
20101224193649.000|20101224193652.000|TR0|More than a thousand years later, the 
20101224193652.000|20101224193654.000|TR0|story of the bishop who gave gifts to the 
20101224193654.000|20101224193657.000|TR0|poor spread, and eventually evolved into 
20101224193657.000|20101224193659.000|TR0|this guy, Santa Claus.  The mayor of Demre 
20101224193659.000|20101224193702.000|TR0|is a big fan of the round red version.  He 
20101224193702.000|20101224193704.000|TR0|plans to put a big red Santa statue up 
20101224193704.000|20101224193707.000|TR0|overlooking the new street and beach he 
20101224193707.000|20101224193709.000|TR0|recently named after Father Christmas.
20101224193709.000|20101224193712.000|TR0|
20101224193712.000|20101224193714.000|TR0|But some of Demre's younger residents want

20101224193717.000|20101224193719.000|TR0|St. Nick.  "He didn't have magic powers or

20101224193729.000|20101224193732.000|TR0|No matter what version you believe in,

20101224193734.000|20101224193737.000|TR0|spirit of St. Nicholas, giving to those

20101224193814.000|20101224193817.000|TR0|HOLMES:  Well, if you've never experienced 
20101224193817.000|20101224193819.000|TR0|an earthquake -- you never really know 
20101224193819.000|20101224193822.000|TR0|where they're going to hit, right?  Well, 
20101224193822.000|20101224193824.000|TR0|we got a place for you, one town you could 
20101224193824.000|20101224193826.000|TR0|go to where you could almost be guaranteed

20101224193829.000|20101224193831.000|TR0|Since mid- September, this place has been 
20101224193831.000|20101224193834.000|TR0|shaken by hundreds -- literally hundreds 
20101224193834.000|20101224193836.000|TR0|-- of earthquakes, one town.  Our Sarah 
20101224193836.000|20101224193839.000|TR0|Hoye reports.     (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101224193839.000|20101224193841.000|TR0|
20101224193841.000|20101224193844.000|TR0|SARAH HOYE, CNN ALL-PLATFORM JOURNALIST 
20101224193844.000|20101224193846.000|TR0|(voice-over):  Guy, Arkansas, population 
20101224193846.000|20101224193849.000|TR0|around 500 very nervous people.  Since 
20101224193849.000|20101224193851.000|TR0|mid- September, this part of Arkansas has 
20101224193851.000|20101224193854.000|TR0|experienced roughly 500 earthquakes.  
20101224193854.000|20101224193856.000|TR0|Sharon and Kerry Strickland (ph) were home 
20101224193856.000|20101224193859.000|TR0|when one struck.
20101224193859.000|20101224193901.000|TR0|

20101224193931.000|20101224193934.000|TR0|SCOTT AUSBROOKS, ARKANSAS GEOLOGICAL

20101224193944.000|20101224193946.000|TR0|MAYOR SAM HIGDON, GUY, ARKANSAS:  My wife 
20101224193946.000|20101224193949.000|TR0|would like to buy earthquake insurance.  
20101224193949.000|20101224193951.000|TR0|I'm trying to talk her out of it.
20101224193951.000|20101224193954.000|TR0|
20101224193954.000|20101224193956.000|TR0|HOYE:  Guy's mayor, Sam Higdon, says the 
20101224193956.000|20101224193959.000|TR0|earthquakes don't really bother people 
20101224193959.000|20101224194001.000|TR0|much.
20101224194001.000|20101224194004.000|TR0|
20101224194004.000|20101224194006.000|TR0|HIGDON:  From about a two, seven, eight 
20101224194006.000|20101224194009.000|TR0|gauge to 3-something, it'll rattle the 
20101224194009.000|20101224194011.000|TR0|windows, shake a few pictures on the wall. 
20101224194011.000|20101224194014.000|TR0| Just -- it doesn't last but five, six, 
20101224194014.000|20101224194016.000|TR0|ten seconds.
20101224194016.000|20101224194019.000|TR0|
20101224194019.000|20101224194021.000|TR0|HOYE:  But people do wonder what's causing 
20101224194021.000|20101224194023.000|TR0|them.  Here's one theory.  Guy sits atop 
20101224194023.000|20101224194026.000|TR0|what's called the Fayetteville shale, a 
20101224194026.000|20101224194028.000|TR0|huge field of natural gas buried beneath 
20101224194028.000|20101224194031.000|TR0|layers of rock.
20101224194031.000|20101224194033.000|TR0|
20101224194033.000|20101224194036.000|TR0|SHANE KHOURY, ARKANSAS OIL AND GAS 
20101224194036.000|20101224194038.000|TR0|COMMISSION:  This is the Fayetteville 
20101224194038.000|20101224194041.000|TR0|shale.  As you can see, there's no gas 
20101224194041.000|20101224194043.000|TR0|that's going to come out of that.  So 
20101224194043.000|20101224194046.000|TR0|you're going to have to hydraulically 
20101224194046.000|20101224194048.000|TR0|fracture rock to get gas out of it.
20101224194048.000|20101224194051.000|TR0|
20101224194051.000|20101224194053.000|TR0|HOYE:  The process of fracturing rock is 
20101224194053.000|20101224194056.000|TR0|called, naturally enough, fracking.  Wells 
20101224194056.000|20101224194058.000|TR0|are blasted deep into the earth with a 
20101224194058.000|20101224194101.000|TR0|high- pressure mixture of water and 
20101224194101.000|20101224194103.000|TR0|chemicals.  When the drilling is done, the 
20101224194103.000|20101224194106.000|TR0|mixture, called fracking fluid, is 
20101224194106.000|20101224194108.000|TR0|disposed of by injecting it into so-called 
20101224194108.000|20101224194111.000|TR0|disposal wells reaching well below the 
20101224194111.000|20101224194113.000|TR0|water table. Could that be what's causing 
20101224194113.000|20101224194116.000|TR0|the earthquakes?
20101224194116.000|20101224194118.000|TR0|
20101224194118.000|20101224194121.000|TR0|AUSBROOKS:  So the question is, is this 
20101224194121.000|20101224194123.000|TR0|natural (INAUDIBLE) Or is this being 
20101224194123.000|20101224194126.000|TR0|triggered, enhanced or induced by what -- 
20101224194126.000|20101224194128.000|TR0|by the injection (INAUDIBLE)
20101224194128.000|20101224194131.000|TR0|
20101224194131.000|20101224194133.000|TR0|HOYE:  Arkansas oil and gas regulators 
20101224194133.000|20101224194136.000|TR0|aren't sure.
20101224194136.000|20101224194138.000|TR0|
20101224194138.000|20101224194141.000|TR0|KHOURY:  You know, I think everyone 
20101224194141.000|20101224194143.000|TR0|recognizes that there is an increased 
20101224194143.000|20101224194146.000|TR0|number of seismic events occurring in and 
20101224194146.000|20101224194148.000|TR0|around this area. If you look at the maps, 
20101224194148.000|20101224194151.000|TR0|at least circumstantially, there appears 
20101224194151.000|20101224194153.000|TR0|to be evidence that they may be related to

20101224194445.000|20101224194447.000|TR0|
20101224194447.000|20101224194450.000|TR0|HOLMES:  Well, as part of a special called 
20101224194450.000|20101224194452.000|TR0|"Giving in Focus," CNN photojournalists 
20101224194452.000|20101224194455.000|TR0|have been shooting stories about all 
20101224194455.000|20101224194457.000|TR0|different kinds of generosity.  Well, take 
20101224194457.000|20101224194500.000|TR0|Trackr, a search rescue dog, spend his 
20101224194500.000|20101224194502.000|TR0|entire 16 years serving and protecting, 
20101224194502.000|20101224194505.000|TR0|did so much good over the years, he was 
20101224194505.000|20101224194507.000|TR0|named the world's most clone-worthy dog, 
20101224194507.000|20101224194510.000|TR0|and his DNA has been replicated several 
20101224194510.000|20101224194512.000|TR0|times over.  Now the clone pups are trying 
20101224194512.000|20101224194515.000|TR0|to follow in his footsteps.  Let's go with 
20101224194515.000|20101224194517.000|TR0|our photojournalist now as he looks at 
20101224194517.000|20101224194520.000|TR0|Trackr's legacy.

20101224194532.000|20101224194535.000|TR0|
20101224194535.000|20101224194537.000|TR0|Every 10 minutes in this country, somebody 
20101224194537.000|20101224194540.000|TR0|is in need of life- saving search and 
20101224194540.000|20101224194542.000|TR0|rescue resources.  The Team Trackr 
20101224194542.000|20101224194545.000|TR0|Foundation is about continuing Trackr's 
20101224194545.000|20101224194547.000|TR0|exactly search and rescue legacy while at

20101224194555.000|20101224194557.000|TR0|We arrived at Ground Zero within 14 hours 
20101224194557.000|20101224194600.000|TR0|of the towers collapsing.  K-9 resources 
20101224194600.000|20101224194602.000|TR0|were in short supply, and we immediately 
20101224194602.000|20101224194604.000|TR0|began searching for survivors.  Sometime 
20101224194604.000|20101224194607.000|TR0|late on the morning of September 12th,
